result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenon D. DENFELD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Conspracy to Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling and work towards his high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any victim unless approved by the agent, except contact with Todd Ward as allowed.

No contact with any of the co-defendants.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling and work towards his high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any victim unless approved by the agent, except contact with Todd Ward as allowed.  

No contact with any of the co-defendants.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

WAIVER HEARING - 
Defendant is waived into adult court.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that reside with his mother, attend school with no unexcused absences, follow all home rules to include 10:00 p.m. curfew and no contact with Ryan Greetan or P.C.Y., DOB: 01-03-2004.  Bail furnished.
